messages.message: @Jarett and I ran into a similar UX issue on this yesterday. It was not clear to a new user (hey @Jarett :wave:) how to add the files to use multi-doc reasoning. The fact you have to click into the Search box and then click each file was not obvious
Yes, we have heard this feedback from other users also. We will be making usability improvements for this in upcoming releases.

here’s the screenshot from raj and his context:

“Below is the screen shot when I select the relevant document , I got the answer.
When I add multiple documents for the search by using the “+” button, i see the 2 documents in the panel (It is not captured in the screenshot), it says the relevant information is not available.”
On this screenshot it looks like there are the same two documents selected for both queries

yeah, pay stub both times — so why does it not return the same answer the second time? Is it assuming he is asking for more information about who Matthis is than what was returned in the previous answer?
my guess is he ran out of credits and the calculation stops somewhere in the middle..... let's give him more credits?
fwiw i tried "who is matthias" for like 20 times and it gives me very consistent answer
oh interesting, that must be it
